answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some examples of how other cities handle team league registration and payment.
The Township of Wayne requires payment in person or through the mail.
http://waynetownship.com/parks-recsched.htm
This is the link to the San Francisco Softball league. Their fees need to be paid in person with a credit card, money order, or cashier’s check.
http://www.sfsoftball.com/league-info-rules/player-information/official-roster/
St. Paul, MN and Sahuarita, AZ both have online registration for their sports leagues and they use the same active net portal.
St. Paul, MN
http://activenet6.active.com/saintpaul/servlet/registrationmain.sdi?online_site_id=2&popup_window=yes
Sahuarita, AZ
http://ci.sahuarita.az.us/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=37
http://ci.sahuarita.az.us/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=61&Itemid=72
This is the City of Los Angeles, Department of Recreation and Parks also has an internet payment and registration option.
http://www.laparks.org/eregistration.htm
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Lavar Carmichel
text: How does everyone have teams/individuals register for leagues?  Paypal, in person?
title: Regisration for league
